p: In alpine meadows, however, seedling recruitment patterns have remained unclear (Chambers, 1995; Forbis, 2003). Before this research, we propose the following hypothesis: (a) seedling density determines species richness (Henry, Stevens, & Carson, 1999); (b) climate change could decrease species richness and increase seedlings density (Arft et al., 1999; Klein et al., 2007; Post & Pedersen, 2008); (c) grazing could cause plant dominant functional groups changed from graminoids with asexual reproduction to forbs with sexual reproduction (Forbis, 2003).
